org.cruk.genologics.api.tools

Class GenologicsAPITools

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cruk.genologics.api.tools.GenologicsAPITools

  • public class GenologicsAPITools
extends Object
    A set of helpful utilities for general functionality around the API.

    These utilities may be of use to others, but their primary purpose is to support operations done here at CRUK-CI.

      • findSequencingProcessesForFlowcell

        public List<GenologicsProcess> findSequencingProcessesForFlowcell(String flowcellId,
                                                         boolean completeOnly)
        Find all the sequencing processes that have a finish date that used the flow cell with the giving id.
        Parameters:
        flowcellId - The id of the flow cell.
        completeOnly - If true, only return processes with a finish date.
        Returns:
        A list of complete sequencing processes (all types) that used the flow cell.

      • findFlowcellByName

        public Container findFlowcellByName(String name)
        Find a flow cell by name (id). This involves a simple look for the container with the name, but in the case of Miseq this can involve looking for a sequencing process with the "Flow Cell ID" field set to the given value, then returning the container used by the process (which will be the reagent cartridge).
        Parameters:
        name - The id of the flow cell.
        Returns:
        The appropriate container used for sequencing with the given id.

      • getBarcodes

        public Map<String,String> getBarcodes()
        Get a map of reagent label name to sequence. This result is held by this tools object for reuse and, by default, cached to a file "barcodes.txt" in the temporary directory, as fetching from the API can be an expensive operation.
        Returns:
        A map of reagent label name to sequence for all reagent types.

      • getBarcodes

        public Map<String,String> getBarcodes(boolean useCache)
        Get a map of reagent label name to sequence. This result is held by this tools object for reuse and, optionally, cached to a file "barcodes.txt" in the temporary directory, as fetching from the API can be an expensive operation.
        Parameters:
        useCache - Whether to read and write to the cache file "barcodes.txt".
        Returns:
        A map of reagent label name to sequence for all reagent types.

      • getBarcodesByReagentCategory

        public Map<String,org.apache.commons.collections15.BidiMap<String,String>> getBarcodesByReagentCategory()
        Get a map of reagent category names to a map of the label name to sequence for barcodes of that category. This result is held by this tools object for reuse and, by default, cached to a file "barcodes.txt" in the temporary directory, as fetching from the API can be an expensive operation.
        Returns:
        A map of reagent category to map of label name to sequence for that reagent type.

      • getBarcodesByReagentCategory

        public Map<String,org.apache.commons.collections15.BidiMap<String,String>> getBarcodesByReagentCategory(boolean useCache)
        Get a map of reagent category names to a map of the label name to sequence for barcodes of that category. This result is held by this tools object for reuse and, optionally, cached to a file "barcodes.txt" in the temporary directory, as fetching from the API can be an expensive operation.
        Parameters:
        useCache - Whether to read and write to the cache file "barcodes.txt".
        Returns:
        A map of reagent category to map of label name to sequence for that reagent type.

      • getQCPasses

        public Map<String,Boolean> getQCPasses(GenologicsProcess sequencingProcess)
        Work out whether the lanes (artifacts) from a sequencing run have been flagged as passing QC.

        A QC value of PASSED indicates a pass; all other values are interpreted as a fail.

        Parameters:
        sequencingProcess - The sequencing process to examine.
        Returns:
        A map of lane artifact LIMS ids to boolean pass or fail flags.

      • getReagentLabelsForSamplesInPool

        public Map<String,String> getReagentLabelsForSamplesInPool(LimsEntityLinkable<Artifact> artifact)
        Get the sample to reagent label mapping for all samples in the given artifact. This recursively traverses back up the history of the artifact (via parent process and earlier artifacts) until a pooling process is found, at which point we can reliably discover which label was applied to each sample from the input artifact to the pooling.

        This is an expensive operation and while this class tries to minimise reloading artifacts and processes, using the optional caching facility around the API is strongly recommended.

        Parameters:
        artifact - The artifact to start from.
        Returns:
        A map of sample LIMS id to reagent label name for all samples in the artifact.

      • getReagentLabelsForSamplesInPools

        public Map<String,Map<String,String>> getReagentLabelsForSamplesInPools(Collection<? extends LimsEntityLinkable<Artifact>> artifacts)
        Adaptation of getReagentLabelsForSamplesInPool for a collection of starting artifacts. Running en masse can help with local reloads, but again the use of the caching facility is strongly recommended.
        Parameters:
        artifacts - A collection of either the artifacts themselves or links to the artifacts.
        Returns:
        A map of starting artifact id to another map of sample LIMS id to reagent label name for all samples in that artifact.
        See Also:
        getReagentLabelsForSamplesInPool(LimsEntityLinkable)

      • getIdentifierForArtifact

        public String getIdentifierForArtifact(Pattern matchPattern,
                              String sampleFieldName,
                              LimsEntityLinkable<Artifact> artifact)
        Find the correct identifier for the given artifact. The history of the artifact is traversed until we find the first artifact with a name that matches the given pattern.

        This is an expensive operation and while this class tries to minimise reloading artifacts, samples and processes, using the optional caching facility around the API is strongly recommended.

        Parameters:
        matchPattern - The pattern to use to locate a suitable identifier.
        sampleFieldName - An optional field name to use to get a value from the original sample if there is no match in the artifact history.
        artifact - The starting artifact.
        Returns:
        The identifier for the artifact. It is possible to get a null back if there is absolutely nothing in the history.

      • getIdentifiersForArtifacts

        public Map<String,String> getIdentifiersForArtifacts(Pattern matchPattern,
                                            String sampleFieldName,
                                            Collection<? extends LimsEntityLinkable<Artifact>> artifacts)
        Adaptation of getIdentifierForArtifact for a collection of starting artifacts. Running en masse can help with local reloads, but again the use of the caching facility is strongly recommended.
        Parameters:
        matchPattern - The pattern to use to locate a suitable identifier.
        sampleFieldName - An optional field name to use to get a value from the original sample if there is no match in the artifact history.
        artifacts - A collection of either the artifacts themselves or links to the artifacts.
        Returns:
        A map of starting artifact id to the identifier found for that artifact. Some of the values in the map may be null if no matching identifier could be found.
        See Also:
        getIdentifierForArtifact(Pattern, String, LimsEntityLinkable)

      • getProcessesUsingArtifact

        public List<GenologicsProcess> getProcessesUsingArtifact(LimsEntityLinkable<Artifact> artifact)
        Get all the processes created from the given artifact. This is recursive, so will include immediate child processes and artifacts that are the outputs of those processes and so forth.

        This is an expensive operation and while this class tries to minimise reloading artifacts and processes, using the optional caching facility around the API is strongly recommended.

        Parameters:
        artifact - The starting artifact.
        Returns:
        A list of processes run on the artifact or its later analytes.

      • getProcessesUsingArtifacts

        public Map<String,List<GenologicsProcess>> getProcessesUsingArtifacts(Collection<? extends LimsEntityLinkable<Artifact>> artifacts)
        Adaptation of getProcessesUsingArtifact to fetch the child processes of many artifacts. Running en masse can help with local reloads, but again the use of the caching facility is strongly recommended.
        Parameters:
        artifacts - The starting artifacts.
        Returns:
        A map of starting artifact LIMS id to a list of processes run on that artifact.
        See Also:
        getProcessesUsingArtifact(LimsEntityLinkable)

      • isDerivedFrom

        public boolean isDerivedFrom(String parentArtifactLimsId,
                    LimsEntityLinkable<Artifact> artifact)
        Check whether the given artifact is derived at some point in its history from a parent artifact.
        Parameters:
        parentArtifactLimsId - The LIMS id of the parent artifact.
        artifact - The artifact to check.
        Returns:
        true if artifact is derived from the artifact given by parentArtifactLimsId, false if not.

      • filterArtifactsDerivedFrom

        public Collection<Artifact> filterArtifactsDerivedFrom(String parentArtifactLimsId,
                                              Collection<? extends LimsEntityLinkable<Artifact>> artifacts)
        Filter from the given collection of artifacts those that were derived from the artifact whose LIMS id is given.
        Parameters:
        parentArtifactLimsId - The LIMS id of the parent artifact.
        artifacts - The artifacts possibly derived from the parent artifact.
        Returns:
        A collection of artifacts from artifacts that were derived from the given parent.

      • filterArtifactsDerivedFrom

        public Map<String,Collection<Artifact>> filterArtifactsDerivedFrom(Collection<String> parentArtifactLimsIds,
                                                          Collection<? extends LimsEntityLinkable<Artifact>> artifacts)
        Filter from the given collection of artifacts those that were derived from the artifacts whose LIMS ids are given.
        Parameters:
        parentArtifactLimsIds - The set of LIMS ids for parent artifacts.
        artifacts - The artifacts possibly derived from the parent artifact.
        Returns:
        A map of parent artifact LIMS id (from parentArtifactLimsIds) to collection of artifacts from artifacts that were derived from each parent.

      • getFormativeArtifact

        public Artifact getFormativeArtifact(Pattern nameMatchPattern,
                            boolean includeSampleArtifact,
                            LimsEntityLinkable<Artifact> artifact)
        Find the artifact that the given artifact was derived from whose name matches the given pattern. Optionally, if there is no match, return the original artifact created at sample submission.

        This is an expensive operation and while this class tries to minimise reloading artifacts, samples and processes, using the optional caching facility around the API is strongly recommended.

        Parameters:
        nameMatchPattern - The pattern to use to locate a formative artifact by name.
        includeSampleArtifact - Whether to return the original sample artifact if no later one was found by name.
        artifact - The starting artifact.
        Returns:
        The formative artifact from which artifact was derived. It is possible to get a null back if there is absolutely nothing in the history and includeSampleArtifact is false.

      • getFormativeArtifacts

        public Map<String,Artifact> getFormativeArtifacts(Pattern nameMatchPattern,
                                         boolean includeSampleArtifact,
                                         Collection<? extends LimsEntityLinkable<Artifact>> artifacts)
        Adaptation of getFormativeArtifact for a collection of starting artifacts. Running en masse can help with local reloads, but again the use of the caching facility is strongly recommended.
        Parameters:
        nameMatchPattern - The pattern to use to locate a formative artifact by name.
        includeSampleArtifact - Whether to return the original sample artifact if no later one was found by name.
        artifacts - A collection of either the artifacts themselves or links to the artifacts.
        Returns:
        A map of starting artifact id to the formative artifact found for that artifact. Some of the values in the map may be null if there is nothing in the history for a given artifact and includeSampleArtifact is false.
        See Also:
        getFormativeArtifact(Pattern, boolean, LimsEntityLinkable)
